intro: Binghamia aurivilla, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in spherical inflorescences. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. Its leaves are typically bipinnate, consisting of multiple small leaflets. Binghamia aurivilla is often found in sandy soils and is well adapted to the dry conditions of its native habitat.
